trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Mozy Enterprise | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Mozy Enterprise | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mozy Enterprise with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mozy Enterprise with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Mozy Enterprise.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Mozy Enterprise.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Mozy Enterprise tenant
trans-unit.target: A Mozy Enterprise tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Mozy Enterprise will be able to single sign into the application at your Mozy Enterprise company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Mozy Enterprise will be able to single sign into the application at your Mozy Enterprise company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Mozy Enterprise
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Mozy Enterprise

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Mozy Enterprise.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Mozy Enterprise.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type mozy enterprise.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type mozy enterprise.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Mozy Enterprise, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Mozy Enterprise, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Mozy Enterprise</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Mozy Enterprise</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Mozy Enterprise with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Mozy Enterprise with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Mozy Enterprise tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Mozy Enterprise tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Mozy Enterprise application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Mozy Enterprise application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Mozy Enterprise page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Mozy Enterprise page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Mozy Enterprise Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.Mozyenterprise.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Mozy Enterprise Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.Mozyenterprise.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Mozy Enterprise company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Mozy Enterprise company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the Configuration section, click Authentication Policy.
trans-unit.target: In the Configuration section, click Authentication Policy.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication policy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication policy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Authentication Policy section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Authentication Policy section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication policy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication policy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Directory Service as Provider.
trans-unit.target: Select Directory Service as Provider.

trans-unit.source: Select Use LDAP Push.
trans-unit.target: Select Use LDAP Push.

trans-unit.source: Click the SAML Authentication tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SAML Authentication tab.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise dialog page, copy the Authentication Request URL value, and then paste it into the Authentication URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise dialog page, copy the Authentication Request URL value, and then paste it into the Authentication URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the SAML Endpoint textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the SAML Endpoint textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into SAML Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into SAML Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SSO for Admins to log in with their network credentials.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SSO for Admins to log in with their network credentials.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Mozy Enterprise dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Mozy Enterprise, they must be provisioned into Mozy Enterprise.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Mozy Enterprise, they must be provisioned into Mozy Enterprise.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Mozy Enterprise, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Mozy Enterprise, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Mozy Enterprise tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Mozy Enterprise tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click Users, and then click Add New User.
trans-unit.target: Click Users, and then click Add New User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Add New User option is only displayed only if Mozy is selected as the provider under Authentication policy.
trans-unit.target: The Add New User option is only displayed only if Mozy is selected as the provider under Authentication policy.

trans-unit.source: If SAML Authentication is configured then the users are added automatically on their first login through Single sign on.
trans-unit.target: If SAML Authentication is configured then the users are added automatically on their first login through Single sign on.

trans-unit.source: On the new user dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the new user dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Choose a Group list, select a group.
trans-unit.target: From the Choose a Group list, select a group.

trans-unit.source: From the What type of user list, select a type.
trans-unit.target: From the What type of user list, select a type.

trans-unit.source: In the Username textbox, type the name of the Azure AD user.
trans-unit.target: In the Username textbox, type the name of the Azure AD user.

trans-unit.source: In the Email textbox, type the email address of the Azure AD user.
trans-unit.target: In the Email textbox, type the email address of the Azure AD user.

trans-unit.source: Select Send user instruction email.
trans-unit.target: Select Send user instruction email.

trans-unit.source: Click Add User(s).
trans-unit.target: Click Add User(s).

trans-unit.source: After creating the user, an email will be sent to the Azure AD user that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: After creating the user, an email will be sent to the Azure AD user that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Mozy Enterprise user account creation tools or APIs provided by Mozy Enterprise to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Mozy Enterprise user account creation tools or APIs provided by Mozy Enterprise to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Mozy Enterprise **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Mozy Enterprise **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
